p: Tipranavir ( N-[3-[(1 R)-1-[(2 R)-6-hydroxy-4-oxo-2-(2-phenylethyl)-2-propyl-3 H-pyran-5-yl]propy l]phenyl]-5-(trifluoromethyl)pyridin-2-sulfonamid) was approved in 2005, and is used as an anti-HIV compound. The drug was shown to be active against FIV in vitro.Tipranavir completely prevented FIV replication [ 85, 86]. No studies in FIV-infected cats exist so far, and further studies are needed to investigate the potential of tipranavir in naturally infected cats.
